data.title: Not possible to have perfect integers with timer node when values are over 22.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win10 64 bit; ATI 79xx GPU; 24 Gigs RAM; third-gen i7 CPU.
Godot 2.1 Beta (build from July20)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When typing an integer value for the timer node (for the _wait time_ parameter), values over 22 will instead produce a decimal number that's just below the intended value.

So a value of 23 becomes 22.999999
And a value of 600 becomes 599.999987

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open Godot, add a timer node in an empty project, give it an integer value over 22

This shouldn't be too hard to fix I think.

data.title: Scene Import; Material merge issue part deux (Godot is doing a simple scene overwrite in some cases again)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win10 64 bit; ATI 79xx GPU; 24 Gigs RAM; third-gen i7 CPU.
Godot 2.1 Beta (build from July20)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
In more complex cases it seems, the fix to allow proper material merging in the alpha builds of Godot 2.1 seems to have come undone. In the specific case of the following .dae file, the engine is back to doing a simple overwrite (meaning materials have to be re-assigned manually again).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Download the following .dae file, import it to Godot, assign new materials for all slots, and re-import (making sure you have the material merge option checked), all of the materials you assigned in Godot should vanish (with the material index values again reverting to Null).

**zip file (contains the raw scene in Collada format)**
[Test_level5.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/374375/Test_level5.zip)

data.title: Ratio anchoring previews are messed up in the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, Godot 2.0.4.1 and git master HEAD.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Configured a WindowDialog this way:
![spectacle b29738](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16997215/d3f03e30-4eb4-11e6-8a28-e3097c6c1ac8.png) ![spectacle n29738](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16997230/dff94654-4eb4-11e6-8b03-d47c4bf40259.png)

The visual preview and corresponding `rect` properties is quite weird:
![spectacle e29738](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16997252/f3f8b8ba-4eb4-11e6-8ff1-2b7f89f4c299.png)
![spectacle r29738](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16997262/fbc81360-4eb4-11e6-8a8b-7e7b53c4b0d9.png)

But the running game works fine:
![spectacle y30143](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16997313/1104a4a0-4eb5-11e6-814b-1352a5fa0530.png)

data.title: Importing a scene with a Navmesh does not place a generic navigation node.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win10 64 bit; ATI 79xx GPU; 24 Gigs RAM; third-gen i7 CPU
Godot 2.1 beta (Built on July20).

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Importing a 3D scene with an object containing the -navmesh suffix will create a mesh like it should, but the fact that the importer does not create it as a child of a _navigation_ node means it will not work out of the box.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a mesh with the -navmesh suffix and import into Godot, you should see a little notice triangle informing that it's not a child of the required navigation node.

data.title: GDParser reports invalid operands syntax error on wrong line
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, Godot 2.0.4.1 and git master HEAD.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When typing an invalid expression like `var test = 42 + "a"`, the error is reported at column 0 of the following line.
![spectacle r29012](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16996417/83c9edc8-4eb1-11e6-97de-793d1556f796.png)

If the invalid expression is end with a semi-colon, however, it works fine:
![spectacle j29012](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16996457/aa41bde6-4eb1-11e6-99ae-4f9f84720877.png)

data.title: Improved FileSystem dock "Instance" option
data.body:
Now the instance operation create just one `UndoRedo` action, instead of creating one for every scene.
- For this i had created a new private function to instance scenes, `SceneTreeDock::_perform_instance_scene`. And the behavior of `SceneTreeDock::instance_scenes`(The old code is now in `_perform_instance_scene`) to work like the `SceneTreeDock::instance` function, but you can provide the parent node.

data.title: Freeze in core/map.h when zooming out too much in the 2D viewport
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x86, git master HEAD

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When zooming out with the mouse wheel until everything in the 2D viewport becomes super tiny, the editor freezes.
GDB reports it as a SIGINT and gives the following backtrace:

```
Thread 1 "godot-git" received signal SIGINT, Interrupt.
0x000000000139ea7d in Map<SpatialIndexer2D::CellKey, SpatialIndexer2D::CellData, Comparator<SpatialIndexer2D::CellKey>, DefaultAllocator>::find (this=0x4e7ed90, p_key=...)
    at core/map.h:562
562             }
(gdb) bt
#0  0x000000000139ea7d in Map<SpatialIndexer2D::CellKey, SpatialIndexer2D::CellData, Comparator<SpatialIndexer2D::CellKey>, DefaultAllocator>::find (this=0x4e7ed90, p_key=...)
    at core/map.h:562
#1  0x000000000139e6df in SpatialIndexer2D::_update (this=0x4e7ed90) at scene/resources/world_2d.cpp:246
#2  0x000000000139c719 in World2D::_update (this=0x4e6c050) at scene/resources/world_2d.cpp:331
#3  0x0000000000f1bbe8 in Viewport::update_worlds (this=0x4e6bb60) at scene/main/viewport.cpp:282
#4  0x00000000004aa664 in MethodBind0::call (this=0x35e4cb0, p_object=0x4e6bb60, p_args=0x7fffffffd280, p_arg_count=0, r_error=...) at core/method_bind.inc:47
#5  0x0000000001857c73 in Object::call (this=0x4e6bb60, p_method=..., p_args=0x7fffffffd280, p_argcount=0, r_error=...) at core/object.cpp:896
#6  0x00000000018577aa in Object::call (this=0x4e6bb60, p_name=..., p_arg1=..., p_arg2=..., p_arg3=..., p_arg4=..., p_arg5=...) at core/object.cpp:770
#7  0x0000000000f06006 in SceneTree::call_group (this=0x38e4730, p_call_flags=2, p_group=..., p_function=..., p_arg1=..., p_arg2=..., p_arg3=..., p_arg4=..., p_arg5=...)
    at scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp:215
#8  0x0000000000f07358 in SceneTree::iteration (this=0x38e4730, p_time=0.0166666675) at scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp:503
#9  0x00000000004317bf in Main::iteration () at main/main.cpp:1573
#10 0x000000000041485b in OS_X11::run (this=0x7fffffffd760) at platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:2016
#11 0x000000000040cf20 in main (argc=4, argv=0x7fffffffdc68) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:41
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Zoom out, way too much

data.title: Implement get_screen_dpi() on Android
data.body:
This will implement the OS::get_screen_dpi() method for Android.

On Android Devices, the actual screen densities are grouped into six generalized densities.
The possible return values are currently:

```
dpi     - 120 dpi
mdpi    - 160 dpi
hdpi    - 240 dpi
xhdpi   - 320 dpi
xxhdpi  - 480 dpi
xxxhdpi - 640 dpi
```

The info are taken from:
 [Stack Overflow -- getting the screen density programmatically in android](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3166501/getting-the-screen-density-programmatically-in-android)

data.title: [TRACKER] Collada export/import issues
data.body:
This is a tracker for Collada export/import issues. Some of those might have to be addressed directly at https://github.com/godotengine/collada-exporter, but since I have little experience with this I can't really judge if issues are at the export or import step.
- [x] Collada Importing Problem #507
- [ ] import/export issue of scene (attached) #1077
- [ ] "Triangulate" option of Better Collada Exporter not compatible with "Shape-Keys" (morph) animations. #1312
- [ ] Mesh animation distortion when importing Collada (from blender export) #1316
- [ ] DAE export/import problem with multimesh skeletons and meshes having shape keys #1333
- [ ] Collada files import into Godot with missing geometry (OpenCollada exporter) #3357
- [ ] Trimesh Static bodies generated incorrectly #3947
- [ ] Importing COLLADA file with armature controlling multiple meshes causes segfault #6222
- [ ] Importer keeps -loop and -cycle suffixes in animation names but removes suffixes in nodes #6582
- [ ] The "-lod:dist" import flag does not work. #7523
- [ ] (slighly unclear) 3D armature import is broken #4120

data.title: WebSockets for Godot
data.body:
WebSockets are really simple to use, esp. when creating multiplayer games. I am suggesting there be a WebSocket node in Godot 3. That way one can easily create a client & hook it up to an existing server effortlessly.

I don't know if WebSockets are already supported in the current networking model, but so far I haven't seen mention of it anywhere & I wouldn't know how to implement it using the HTTP nodes. Sorry if this issue is a result of my ignorance.

data.title: Load Erros dialog only show when reloaded the project.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Lubuntu 16.04LTS (32 bit)
Godot Engine version : v.2.0.4.1.stable.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Assume that you already open the project.
When you remove the assets that node is depends on for example sprite node with loaded image.
After removed the assets and click play(F5), You can't run the game (game crash) and no error dialog about broken dependencies or load errors has show.
Unless, you reload the project and the load errors dialog will show. But it'll never show before you click to play the game.
![after_reload_project](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9628627/16945828/f3fcdef2-4dd0-11e6-9b28-fcdadbea834a.png)
//I think load errors dialog should show every time you are about to play the game but the node dependencies is broken.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Open the project
2) Remove the assets : images/monster/enemy_dummy_r_96.png
3) Play the project (F5) and the game will crash and load errors dialog will not show.
4) Reload this project
5) Now load errors dialog will show and after you close its dialog and play the game, loads errors dialog will not show.

**Note:**
When you remove the assets in the godot engine, this dialog will warn you about its dependencies.
![when_remove_assets_within_godot_engine](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9628627/16946417/97492ef6-4dd3-11e6-91fe-3603c46def05.png) 
But if you remove the assets in the file explorer(default os file explorer not file system's tab in godot engine), you will never know if you accidently broke the dependencies. After click to play the game, no loads errors dialog will show. (same issue)

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[Test.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/371105/Test.tar.gz)

data.title: Fix tooltips blinking
data.body: Fixes #5695

data.title: Game Button and Mode For Seamless Experience
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any OS, any Godot version

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
This is a feature request. I opened an [issue](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5762) that is similar to this, but I wanted to expand on it.

I feel like there should be a Game button in the grid where 2D, 3D, Script, and now AssetLib are. I feel like this would be cleaner for the interface rather than opening the game in it's own window. With the game window open it's harder to get to the debugger, profiler, see your scripts, etc, unless you're running dual monitors. I think the way Unity does it is really great. Everything is totally accessible because of the game tab. Even Blender similarly does this with rendering by putting your render in interface when pressing F12.

How it would work is you can click on the game button to see it, or when you press play it automatically goes to the game mode.

Maybe still including the option to open a window is good for people with more than one monitor.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

Either I am doing something wrong or this is a bug in 2.1 beta

data.title: CollisionShapes added to inherited scenes are ignored
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
ubuntu 16.04, godot: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/b49476a0119bd177341a2e974d62b591117efe3f

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Import scene, set "Custom root Node Type" to RigidBody
- create a new inherited scene with above scene as base
- in the inherited scene add a collision shape, with SphereShape or whatever.

Now instances of this scene will not collide with anything, however if you add a collision shape to
the base scene as well, run your game, then delete the shape from base scene, the inherited scene will keep colliding. But this step has to be repeated each time the base scene is reimported.

I use scn for base and tscn for inherited scene.

edit:
actually you don't have to start the game after creating collisionShape in base scene, just add it and delet it. With debug collision shapes enabled the shape in the inherited scene will be rendered, but the shape in use by physics is actually the one in base scene,which should be deleted.

data.title: Zoom with mouse wheel in the new TextureRegion editor
data.body:
Not much of an issue, but the old TextureRegion editor allowed to use the mouse wheel to zoom in and out. The new one doesn't, and you have to click the buttons on the top right (Windows 10 did that too in its new image viewer and I hate it :p).
Is it possible to have the mouse wheel back please? :3
